p: The efficacy of caraway oil (50 mg) and peppermint oil (41.5 mg) versus placebo over a treatment period of 28 days in reduction of Global Overall Symptoms (GOS) and Clinical Global Impressions (CGI) of patients suffering from functional dyspepsia were evaluated. At the end of treatment, PDS (78%) and EPS (72%) patients in intervention group reported the treatment “good” or “very good” in CGI assessment, while the corresponding values in placebo group were 50% (PDS) (p = 0.09) and 40% (EPS) (p = 0.046), respectively. The sensations of pressure, heaviness, fullness, reduction in epigastric pain or discomfort symptoms improved no significantly compared to placebo group [ 83].
